properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly winds will persist this evening with Les Suetes gusting to 90 km/h. Winds are expected to shift to northeast and diminish slightly near midnight tonight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-22T07:14:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-21T18:31:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1215752304.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wintry Mix expected for Wednesday night. Scattered showers or flurries will change to rain or wet snow over the Great Northern Peninsula and the Northeast Coast Wednesday evening. Snowfall accumulations will range from just a trace or less over lower elevations at the coast, to generally around 5 cm inland and over higher terrain, with localized heavier totals possible. Motorists are advised to expect winter driving conditions over some of the higher highway routes on Wednesday evening into Thursday morning. Any accumulated snow will likely melt again as temperatures rise Thursday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-22T02:20:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-21T18:21:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0348571758.2019
Area: Gros Morne, Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Gander and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova, Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke from wildfires in northern Alberta continues to affect some areas in the southern Northwest Territories. Air quality remains poor over Fort Simpson, Hay River, and the Fort Providence areas. With winds expected to shift later tonight, the smoke should exit the area by Tuesday morning ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. When outdoors, if your breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce strenuous physical activities. If you experience irritation of eyes, nose or throat, shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, you should take action to reduce your exposure to smoke. If you are feeling unwell and experiencing symptoms, contact your health care provider for advice. Issued jointly by Environment Canada and the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services. For more information on air quality and your health, please visit the Northwest Territories Department of Health and Social Services at www.hss.gov.nt.ca/en/services/environmental-health/air-quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-05-21T20:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services, 2019-05-21T05:18:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3062616024.2019
Area: Ft. Simpson Region including Jean Marie River, Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, Hay River Region including Enterprise
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: A wildfire is threatening the community of Bushe River and an Evacuation Order has been issued by Chief and Council of the Dene Tha’ First Nation. All residents must register now at the Four Chiefs Complex in Bushe River prior to evacuating. More evacuation information will be provided at the Four Chiefs Complex. # The evacuation route is east on Highway 58 to Highway 88 towards Fort Vermillion and La Crete. Go to the Dene Tha’ First Nation Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/DeneThaFirstNation/ for more information.
Expires: 2019-05-27T20:18:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of the Dene Tha' First Nation, 2019-05-20T20:17:01-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5745
Area: Bushe River Reserve #207
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of the Dene Tha' First Nation

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected or occurring. Easterly winds will strengthen in the Wreckhouse area this evening with gusts to 110 km/h before diminishing upon turning to northeasterly near midnight. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-22T08:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-21T18:21:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2184218620.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: UPDATE 6: The Town of High Level is now issuing an Evacuation Order as of May 20, 2019 at 4:00 pm. ## Lock doors and windows, take small personal belongings including pets, identification, medication, cash). Within your homes please ensure all fuel and gas appliances are shut off, and hot water tanks are turned down if able to. ### The first Evacuation Zone to be evacuated will be Zone 6 (Yellow Zone on the Map Bellow) the Collection point for residents that are unable to self-evacuate is Spirit of the North Community School. ### Continue to monitor the Town Website at www.highlevel.ca and the Alberta Wildfire website at www.wildfire.alberta.ca. Monitor Alberta 511 website https://511.alberta.ca/region/Northern%20Alberta#:Alerts
Expires: 2019-05-27T16:52:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Town Of High Level, 2019-05-20T16:50:45-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5742
Area: High Level
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Town Of High Level

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert West Of Edson Near Marlboro Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Residents are allowed back into the area but will remain on evacuation alert notice and may need to evacuate again in a short period of time if the fire situation changes. ### Residents in the area will remain on evacuation alert notice and able to stay at their residences overnight. Dozer guard is 100% around fire in order to help prevent the spread of the fire outside the contained area. Heavy equipment and wildfire firefighters are still working on site and will be on site starting early in the morning. The Yellowhead County Emergency Operations Centre and evacuee information number (1-833-334-4630) will be stood down at 6:00 PM tonight and will start up again at 8:00 AM tomorrow morning. Please go to www.wildfire.alberta.ca for the most recent updates on the fire and go to www.yellowheadcounty.ab.ca and the Yellowhead County facebook page for local resident information. Go to the Yellowhead County Facebook page and the Yellowhead County website at www.yellowheadcounty.ab.ca for more information and www.wildfire.alberta.ca
Expires: 2019-05-27T17:58:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Yellowhead County, 2019-05-20T17:57:00-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5743
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke from wildfires in northern Alberta continues to affect some areas in the southern Northwest Territories. Air quality remains poor over Fort Simpson, Hay River, and the Fort Providence areas. Winds are expected to continue to shift to a more northerly direction this afternoon and move the smoke away from the area. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. When outdoors, if your breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce strenuous physical activities. If you experience irritation of eyes, nose or throat, shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, you should take action to reduce your exposure to smoke. If you are feeling unwell and experiencing symptoms, contact your health care provider for advice. Issued jointly by Environment Canada and the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services. For more information on air quality and your health, please visit the Northwest Territories Department of Health and Social Services at www.hss.gov.nt.ca/en/services/environmental-health/air-quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-05-22T02:59:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services, 2019-05-21T16:26:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2490453592.2019
Area: Ft. Simpson Region including Jean Marie River, Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake, Hay River Region including Enterprise
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke from wildfires in northern Alberta is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Winds are expected to gradually shift from southeasterly to easterly today forcing the smoke westward towards Rainbow Lake and northern BC. Tonight winds will become northeasterly confining smoke near and south of High Level. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-05-22T08:22:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-05-21T16:23:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0363942898.2019
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La Crête and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves
properties.Author: Environment Canada,  Alberta Environment and Parks,  Alberta Health,  Alberta Health Services

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wintry mix expected early Wednesday. Rain will spread across southern and eastern Newfoundland tonight, and then transition to wet snow over many areas as temperatures turn cooler during the early hours of Wednesday. Snowfall accumulations will range from just a trace or less over lower elevations at the coast, to generally around 5 cm inland and over higher terrain, with localized heavier totals possible. Motorists are advised to expect winter driving conditions over some of the higher highway routes on Wednesday morning. Any accumulated snow will likely melt again as temperatures rise Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-05-22T02:20:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-21T18:21:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1087554889.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, Avalon Peninsula Southeast, St. John's and vicinity, Avalon Peninsula Southwest, Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Burgeo - Ramea

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Frost is expected to be widespread this morning as temperatures have dropped to zero. A few locations could drop to a couple of degrees below zero before rising quickly after sunrise. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures are expected to fall to near freezing mark overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Update 1:Mackenzie County has issued a mandatory Evacuation Order for residents South and Southeast of the Town of High Level and South of the Bushe River Reserve due to wildfire threat. A State Of Local Emergency is now in effect for Mackenzie County. Evacuees must now register at the La Crete Heritage Centre. ### Crews will be going door to door to notify affected residents. Manned barricades will be set up on all roads to prevent unauthorized entry into the evacuated areas. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-05-27T18:08:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-05-20T18:07:16-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5744
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Mackenzie County
